subject: Mental Health
title: Post-Traumatic Growth After Loss
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Post-Traumatic Growth After Loss.

hook.text: Some people emerge from devastating loss not just healed but fundamentally changed for the better.

buildup.text: Tedeschi and Calhoun described post-traumatic growth ‚Äî positive change following trauma or loss.

discovery.text: Growth areas include deeper relationships, new priorities, increased compassion, and spiritual depth.

twist.text: Growth and grief coexist ‚Äî you don't have to stop hurting to start growing.

climax.text: About 50 to 70 percent of bereaved people report some form of post-traumatic growth.

punchline.text: The wound never fully closes. But something new grows around it.

quiz.question: What is post-traumatic growth?
options: Positive psychological change that emerges from struggling with loss
